info.name: SciScope
info.description:
SciScope is a REST API that delivers science news, user-created bookmarks, and analytics insights. Built for educators and science enthusiasts.

### Features

- ğŸ” User authentication via password or OAuth
    
- ğŸ“° Fetch latest news or search by keyword
    
- ğŸ“Œ Bookmark and group favorite articles
    
- ğŸ“Š Analytics for top users and most-bookmarked content

exec: pm.test("Response includes token and user object", () => {

request.description:
Creates a new user with a unique email and password.  
Returns `201 Created` with the new user object.

Attempts to create a user with an email that already exists.  
Should return `400` or `409 Conflict` depending on validation logic.

exec: pm.test("Returns success message and JWT token", () => {

request.description:
Authenticates a user and returns a valid JWT token if credentials are correct.  
Expects a `200 OK` with a token in the response body.

Authenticates a user and returns a valid JWT token if credentials are correct.

Authenticates a user and returns a valid JWT token if credentials are correct.  
Expects a `200 OK` with a token in the response body.

Simulates login using a third-party provider (e.g. Google).  
Accepts `provider` and `oauth_id`, and returns a `200 OK` with a JWT token.

request.description:
Attempts to log in with an unknown OAuth ID.  
Should return `401 Unauthorized` or `404 Not Found`.

Logs out the authenticated user.  
Returns a `200 OK` with a logout confirmation message.  
Requires a valid Bearer token.

request.description:
### Retrieve News

Retrieves the latest science news articles.  
Returns an array of articles with ID, title, description, and published date.

> <p >Returns all bookmarks created by the currently authenticated user.</p>
> <p >Returns all bookmarks created by the currently authenticated user.</p>

Creates a bookmark for the authenticated user using a given article ID.  
Returns `201 Created`.

Attempts to bookmark an article that has already been bookmarked by the user.  
Should return `400 Bad Request` or `409 Conflict` with an appropriate error message.

Deletes a bookmark for the authenticated user by bookmark ID.  
Returns `204 No Content` on success.
